name: execute_code
description: Executes a provided string of Python code and captures the standard output, standard error, and exit code from the execution.

code_string.description: A non-empty string containing the Python code to be executed.

name: execute_script
description: Executes a Python script from a file path and captures the execution results. Returns a dictionary containing the `exit_code`, `stdout`, and `stderr`.

script_path.description: The file path to the Python script to execute. This path must point to an existing file with a `.py` extension.

name: write_to_file
description: Writes content to a specified file, overwriting the file if it already exists. The function automatically uses text mode ('w') for string content and binary mode ('wb') for byte content.

file_path.description: The full path to the destination file, including its name and extension.

content.description: The string or bytes content to be written to the file. The function handles strings as text and bytes as binary data.
